lexUnit.name: thrill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have or cause to have a thrill.

sentence.text: ROY of the Rovers , who has thrilled young football fans for almost 40 years , is to crash out of his own comic in a blazing helicopter .
It thrilled her that he 'd called them that .
The experience so thrilled her that she decided to make a career of it , and by the age of 10 she had performed in three Broadway shows .
` It still thrills me to know my queenly mother did something improper at least once . "
Alesi , thrilling the sparse crowd with his aggressive style , was third fastest in a car specially equipped for the session with new Ferrari V12 engines .
McWilliams thrilled the crowd with the immense power and speed of the Millar Yamaha in his two victories over New Zealander Robert Holden .
STAFF and students at a local boys ' school are preparing to thrill audiences with their latest drama .
They teamed up for an after-show celebration after Elton and rock star Eric Clapton thrilled fans at a huge outdoor concert in New York .
Filled with the magic and beauty that will continue to thrill audiences for years to come , Snow White tells the story of a beautiful young princess and her jealous step mother the queen .
Gunn continues , describing the feelings which thrilled him in that time now past .
The war drums throbbed , a muffled , far-carrying , never-ceasing sound that thrilled me to the core ; the five-foot trumpets brayed .
He catches me watching him and smiles a naughty smile which thrills me to the core .
The thought of the night terrified and thrilled her .
His congratulations did not thrill her .
On a few previous late evening occasions Sherman had been allowed to go to this area and view the gorillas , an event which both scared and thrilled him .
After all , it was not much more than five years since the Westminster Abbey wedding that thrilled the nation , if not the world .
After such stumbles , Grumman is understandably thrilled by a belated and unambiguous triumph : the success of JSTARS .
In this crazy conversation of mutual lies , Marie was thrilled by her own power .
Dustin 's parents were thrilled by the reception and the money the film was making .
Aimee was thrilled by yesterday 's experience and the dog handlers were delighted with her progress in crime and drug-busting techniques .
I well remember Miss Laverock 's staging of the last appearance of Amelita Galli-Curci , the world famous coloratura soprano , and of how thrilled we all were by that amazing and beautiful voice .
Roland was first profoundly shocked by these writings , and then , in his scholarly capacity , thrilled .
